text: Women's History Month is an annual event to celebrate the contributions of women to history. It is celebrated during March in the United States, the United Kingdom, and Australia, together with International Women's Day on March 8. In Canada it is celebrated during October , together with the celebration of Persons Day on October 18. Women's History Month serves as a celebration of the achievements, perseverance, and strength of women throughout history! This month-long event provides an opportunity to educate society about the countless contributions that women have made in a variety of fields globally. == References == Category:March observances Category:Women Category:History Category:October observances
title: Women's History Month
